skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill...

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill with standard templates and helper scripts. No risky operations or network usage are present in the scanned files.

content.user_title: Create structured skills with templates and scripts
content.value_statement: Building a skill can feel unstructured and time consuming. This skill provides a clear process, templates, and helper scripts to produce consistent skills.
actual_capabilities: Explains a six step skill creation workflow with required ordering
Generates a new skill folder with SKILL.md and example resources
Validates SKILL.md frontmatter and naming rules
Packages a skill folder into a .skill zip after validation
Provides reference guides for workflow and output patterns
limitations: Validation only checks frontmatter format and naming rules
Scripts require Python and a YAML library to run
Packaging does not run tests or security scans
Guidance assumes manual editing of generated files

use_cases.title: Draft a new skill
use_cases.description: Create a new skill directory and outline the core workflow and resources.

use_cases.title: Standardize skill quality
use_cases.description: Use the validator and packaging steps to keep team skills consistent.

use_cases.title: Bundle scripts and assets
use_cases.description: Organize scripts, references, and templates for a reusable skill.

prompt_templates.title: Start a new skill
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a basic skill skeleton
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a plan for a new skill named data-cleaner and list the scripts, references, and assets I should include.

prompt_templates.title: Shape the SKILL.md
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a clear description and structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a SKILL.md outline for a customer-support skill with workflow steps and references.

prompt_templates.title: Prepare for packaging
prompt_templates.scenario: You want to validate a skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my skill folder for required files and frontmatter issues before packaging.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced optimization
prompt_templates.scenario: You want a lean skill with references
prompt_templates.prompt: Refactor my skill instructions to keep SKILL.md under 500 lines and move detailed material into references.

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill for processing PDFs with clear steps and reusable scripts.
output: Defined the core PDF tasks and user prompts
Outlined a step by step workflow in SKILL.md
Identified scripts for text extraction and form filling
Suggested reference docs for API usage and examples

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md concise and move details to references
Use scripts for repeated, deterministic operations
Validate and package the skill after changes
anti_patterns: Storing large reference material inside SKILL.md
Including unused example files in the final skill

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides skill structure and scripts that work across Claude, Codex, and Claude Code workflows.

faq.question: What limits should I know about?
faq.answer: Validation checks only frontmatter and naming, not content quality or tests.

faq.question: How do I integrate this into my workflow?
faq.answer: Run the init script, edit SKILL.md and resources, then run the package script.

faq.question: Does it send or store my data?
faq.answer: No. All files and scripts run locally and do not use network access.

faq.question: What if validation fails?
faq.answer: Fix the reported frontmatter or naming issue, then rerun the validator and packaging.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual skill creation?
faq.answer: It provides templates, a clear process, and packaging tools, which reduces errors and saves time.
